org.openimaj.image.processing.face.detection.keypoints

Class FacialKeypointExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.face.detection.keypoints.FacialKeypointExtractor

  • @Reference(type=Inproceedings,
           author={"Mark Everingham","Josef Sivic","Andrew Zisserman"},
           title="Hello! My name is... Buffy - Automatic naming of characters in TV video",
           year="2006",
           booktitle="In BMVC")
public class FacialKeypointExtractor
extends Object
    A class capable of finding likely facial keypoints using a masked Haar cascade for each keypoint, and then picking the best combination of points based on a model.

    Implementation and data is based on Mark Everingham's Oxford VGG Baseline Face Processing Code

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • getCanonicalImageDimension

        public int getCanonicalImageDimension()
        Get the size of the face image that the keypoint extractor can work with.
        Returns:
        the size (both height and width)

      • extractFacialKeypoints

        public FacialKeypoint[] extractFacialKeypoints(org.openimaj.image.FImage canonicalImage)
        Extract the facial keypoints from a canonical image. The image must contain a face and have the dimensions specified by getCanonicalImageDimension().
        Parameters:
        canonicalImage - the canonical image containing a detected face.
        Returns:
        A list of facial keypoints for the image.
